company: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Texas
Job Description: HCSC is committed to diversity in the workplace and to providing equal opportunity and affirmative action to employees and applicants.We are an Equal Opportunity Employment / Affirmative Action employer dedicated to workforce diversity and a drug-free and smoke-free workplace. Drug screening and background investigation are required, as allowed by law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. If you are an individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and need an accommodation or assistance in either using the Careers website or completing the application process, you can email us here to request reasonable accommodations. Please note that only requests for accommodations in the application process will be returned. All applications, including resumes, must be submitted through HCSC's Career website on-line application process. If you have general questions regarding the status of an existing application, navigate to "my account" and click on "View your job submissions".Intern – Graduate – Data Science At HCSC, data is at the center of everything we do. As healthcare fast-pivots towards a future where optimizations across personalization, cost of healthcare delivery and differentiated health outcomes converge, it’s an exciting time to become part of our data-rich, insight-driven environment where we are positioning the broad spectrum of analytics – from descriptive to artificial intelligence - to provide us leapfrog capabilities in a very competitive industry. As an intern with Health Care Service Corporation (HCSC), which operates Blue Cross and Blue Shield plans in Illinois, Montana, New Mexico, Oklahoma and Texas, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to projects that have real impact to our members and communities. THE DEPARTMENT The Analytics and Process Transformation Team partners with areas across HCSC to develop creative solutions to diverse challenges. Our projects are tied directly to business outcomes, from reducing administrative spend to optimizing medical costs to improving revenue processes. As an intern on the team, you will be integral to driving these outcomes. BASIC FUNCTION Interns will work with HCSC leaders, business partners and internal analytics teams across the company to solve business problems through analytics. Examples of business or health care issues for analysis might include testing hypotheses through experiments using advanced analytics and applied artificial intelligence; utilizing advanced mathematical and statistical concepts and theories to analyze and collect data and construct solutions to business problems; identifying trends and patterns; integrating with external data sources and APIs to discover interesting trends; designing rich data visualization; and researching new tools, technologies and trends in the data and analytics space.  This position may be required to perform quantitative analysis or data discovery activities.  Job Requirements:  Progress towards a Masters Degree or PhD in Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Epidemiology or related field GPA of 3.67 or greater Demonstrated interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication Practical, developed PC skills, especially SQL, statistical languages like SAS or R, PowerPoint, Excel, Word Demonstrated analytical skills Experience with SAS, SQL or R-based data analysis and descriptive statistics Experience in a work or academic setting developing and performing advanced analysis and developing recommendations based on a specific business issue  Preferred Job Requirements:  Experience with applied artificial intelligence and machine learning GPA of 4.0 or higher  This position can be located in Chicago, IL or Richardson, TX   To be eligible for consideration, candidates must currently possess unrestricted authorization to work in the United States. Our intent is to convert our interns to permanent employees. At this time we are not sponsoring work visas. You may not require sponsorship for your internship, but if you would require sponsorship for a permanent position with us, we cannot consider you at this time.   Health Care Service Corporation Founded in 1936 and with more than 14.5 million members, HCSC is the largest customer-owned health insurer in the United States and fourth largest overall, operating through its Blue Cross and Blue Shield® Plans in Illinois, Montana, New Mexico, Oklahoma and Texas. We provide health coverage through our Blue Cross and Blue Shield Plans and dental, life and disability insurance through Dearborn National. We are greater than our 22,000+ employees, 60 local offices and state-of-the-art technology, including two Tier IV data centers — the industry's highest reliability level — that provide the speed and data security to meet our customers' current and future business needs. We are one of the most respected companies for compliance, diversity and community outreach in the country. Our health plans were pioneers in their states, as they were the first to provide coverage for a number of procedures — ranging from heart and bone marrow transplants, to cancer and leukemia treatments. We have continued our tradition of industry leadership to this day. We are an Equal Opportunity Employment / Affirmative Action employer dedicated to workforce diversity and a drug-free and smoke-free workplace. Drug screening and background investigation are required, as allowed by law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. LI-POST

position: Director of Product Management – Travel Agent Functionality
Job Description: Job Description :   Apple Leisure Group, the parent company of Apple Vacations, Travel Impressions and CheapCaribbean.com, is looking for a Director of Product Management with relevant experience to articulate, define and execute the product strategy and feature backlog for travel agent-facing technology.  As a senior leader on our e-commerce product team, you will be responsible for overseeing the functionality direction, product managers and user experience designers for the features our travel agents use every day. You will ensure your team thoroughly understands and internalizes customer needs and our business strategy, and produces top quality product requirements at the appropriate pace. You will work daily with your counterparts in engineering in an Agile development environment to help your combined teams deliver and measure the experience our travel agents need to succeed in the marketplace. You must be effective leading through others, demonstrate sound strategic and analytical thinking, maintain good stakeholder communication and hold your own with top-level executives.  Responsibilities:  Hire, motivate and manage the performance of a small, high-performing team of product managers and user experience managers Own and articulate the product strategy for travel agent-facing functionality based on deep first-hand knowledge of relevant data, customer needs and business strategy, incorporating stakeholder feedback as appropriate Manage senior-level stakeholder input, including engaging comfortably in constructive debate with top-level executives Present strategy, progress and product feature to internal stakeholders at a senior level Provide decision support and air cover to product managers as they manage trade-offs between cost, time to market, estimated ROI, and strategic alignment of their features. Ensure counterparts on the engineering team get the quantity and quality of inputs they need to deliver quality features and maintain/improve velocity Be the visible advocate for your feature sets internally and externally      Job Requirements :   Requirements:  5+ years in e-commerce product management, 2+ years in an Agile development environment, 2+ years managing product managers Direct experience with travel technology strongly preferred Outstanding technical, analytical, and problem-solving abilities, along with an ability to collaborate cross-functionally Proven ability to manage conflicting product priorities A passion for data, with very strong quantitative skills Experience in setting test-and-learn plans and applying analytic insights to the test plan Highly organized and adept at prioritization - you can recognize and keep track of all the moving pieces in projects, adjusting to new information and goals First-class influencing skills, including experience working within a large matrix organization Proven self-starter who can identify new opportunities, develop strategies to drive growth, and push projects forward, as well as a desire to push innovation and drive business Excellent communication skills (written and verbal); proven ability to work with cross-functional teams to drive execution against project milestones and deliverables Bachelor degree in Business, Computer Science or related field strongly preferred      To submit your resume for this job, select how you heard about the job and then click the "Submit Your Resume" button below.

If you have general questions regarding the status of an existing application, navigate to "my account" and click on "View your job submissions".Intern – Graduate – Data Science At HCSC, data is at the center of everything we do. As healthcare fast-pivots towards a future where optimizations across personalization, cost of healthcare delivery and differentiated health outcomes converge, it’s an exciting time to become part of our data-rich, insight-driven environment where we are positioning the broad spectrum of analytics – from descriptive to artificial intelligence - to provide us leapfrog capabilities in a very competitive industry. As an intern with Health Care Service Corporation (HCSC), which operates Blue Cross and Blue Shield plans in Illinois, Montana, New Mexico, Oklahoma and Texas, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to projects that have real impact to our members and communities. THE DEPARTMENT The Analytics and Process Transformation Team partners with areas across HCSC to develop creative solutions to diverse challenges. Our projects are tied directly to business outcomes, from reducing administrative spend to optimizing medical costs to improving revenue processes. As an intern on the team, you will be integral to driving these outcomes. BASIC FUNCTION Interns will work with HCSC leaders, business partners and internal analytics teams across the company to solve business problems through analytics. Examples of business or health care issues for analysis might include testing hypotheses through experiments using advanced analytics and applied artificial intelligence; utilizing advanced mathematical and statistical concepts and theories to analyze and collect data and construct solutions to business problems; identifying trends and patterns; integrating with external data sources and APIs to discover interesting trends; designing rich data visualization; and researching new tools, technologies and trends in the data and analytics space.  This position may be required to perform quantitative analysis or data discovery activities.  Job Requirements:  Progress towards a Masters Degree or PhD in Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Epidemiology or related field GPA of 3.67 or greater Demonstrated interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication Practical, developed PC skills, especially SQL, statistical languages like SAS or R, PowerPoint, Excel, Word Demonstrated analytical skills Experience with SAS, SQL or R-based data analysis and descriptive statistics Experience in a work or academic setting developing and performing advanced analysis and developing recommendations based on a specific business issue  Preferred Job Requirements:  Experience with applied artificial intelligence and machine learning GPA of 4.0 or higher  This position can be located in Chicago, IL or Richardson, TX   To be eligible for consideration, candidates must currently possess unrestricted authorization to work in the United States. Our intent is to convert our interns to permanent employees. At this time we are not sponsoring work visas. You may not require sponsorship for your internship, but if you would require sponsorship for a permanent position with us, we cannot consider you at this time.   Health Care Service Corporation Founded in 1936 and with more than 14.5 million members, HCSC is the largest customer-owned health insurer in the United States and fourth largest overall, operating through its Blue Cross and Blue Shield® Plans in Illinois, Montana, New Mexico, Oklahoma and Texas. We provide health coverage through our Blue Cross and Blue Shield Plans and dental, life and disability insurance through Dearborn National. We are greater than our 22,000+ employees, 60 local offices and state-of-the-art technology, including two Tier IV data centers — the industry's highest reliability level — that provide the speed and data security to meet our customers' current and future business needs. We are one of the most respected companies for compliance, diversity and community outreach in the country. Our health plans were pioneers in their states, as they were the first to provide coverage for a number of procedures — ranging from heart and bone marrow transplants, to cancer and leukemia treatments. We have continued our tradition of industry leadership to this day. Job Description: Plano 1 (31061), United States of America, Plano, TexasData Analyst Intern - The University of Texas at AustinOur interns are involved with some of Capital Ones most critical business decisions, and they work with the best and brightest in a collaborative, team-oriented environment. With the explosion of data thats available for making business decisions, youll find yourself in a critical role at the intersection of business strategy and technology. Theyre motivated to develop a deep understanding of data, programming, business insights, and technical skills that are required to harness the power of our extensive data warehouses and execute Capital Ones information-based strategy. They want to work with highly intelligent peers and business leaders in a vibrant, collaborative environment, and develop the skills required to excel.What You Can Expect- Training and Development - Hone your analytical, quantitative skills and soft skills through our award-winning Capital One University.- Executive Speakers Learn from our senior executives as they share their history and vision and offer guidance as you start your career.- Team Building Activities Develop relationships with intern peers, associates and executives at planned social events throughout the summer.- Associate Presentations and Discussions Hear from current associates as they discuss their projects, roles and how to be successful within a premier financial services organization.As a part of the Analyst Internship Program, your projects may include:- Using data mining techniques to identify fraud rings- Testing the effectiveness of our marketing channels- Building the data foundation for Capital Ones digital agenda- Optimizing bank ATM placement through advanced data exploration- Seamlessly integrating data from multiple sources and platforms to generate customer insight- Diving into new data sources to enhance models- Researching web activities to drive enhancements to customer engagement sitesThis is a paid internshipBasic Qualifications- Current student or alumni of The University of Texas at Austin- Will obtain or have obtained a Bachelors degree or higher between December 2017 and August 2018Preferred Qualifications- In process of obtaining a Bachelors Degree or higher in a quantitative major, including business, economics, mathematics, finance, or engineering- Strong quantitative, analytical, problem-solving and conceptual skills- Coursework or relevant work experience in technical programming (i.e. Java, JavaScript, SQL, C++, R, SAS, Python, Spark, Cloud data movement, or other programming language)- Strong interpersonal, leadership and communication skills- Digital Marketing Coordinator (Intern) Part Time    Take your career to the Summit   At Summit Truck Group, one of the countrys leading heavy duty truck dealer groups, our success depends on serving our customers with the best team members in the industry. If your career goals include making a valuable contribution as a Digital Marketing Coordinator (Intern) in an exciting and growing company and working with top professionals in the industry then consider joining our team.   Summit Truck Group in Lewisville, TX is seeking an enthusiastic, hard-working, customer-oriented individuals who can work in a team environment as a Digital Marketing Coordinator (Intern.)    Responsibilities:  Manage and build various email lists and campaigns, including the design templates, calls-to-action, and content used in email sends. Segment lists based on behaviors like past email engagement and website interactions (content downloads, site page visits, etc.). Measure results and optimize the nurture tracks for these segments to convert leads to customers. Work to minimize list decay and unsubscribes while increasing productivity of Summits email sends. Develop documentation and road maps for processes, A/B tests, and promotions that succeed through email. Manage both on-site and off-site SEO for the company. Manage of organic search engine performance and goal-setting based on site impressions, click through rates, traffic, and conversions. Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and changes with SEO and major search engines. Collaborate with marketing teammates to maintain a consistent brand voice and message across all paid programs. Craft landing pages and lead-generation forms for our content to distribute through relevant paid programs.   Create shareable content appropriate for specific networks to both spread our brand and our content and links. Listen and engage in relevant social discussion about our company, competitors, and/or industry, both from existing customers and leads and from brand new audiences that dont yet know us. Run regular social promotions and campaigns and track their success, ranging from Twitter chats, to LinkedIn conversations, as well as the content and links posted through these and other channels. Drive consistent, relevant traffic and leads from our social network presence.    Qualifications:  Working on Four-year college degree in Business Administration or Business of Science and/or equivalent working experience preferred. Past experience with email marketing, lead nurturing, marketing automation, and/or web analytics preferred. Proficient using marketing automation technology. Highly analytical and able to derive meaning from data through A/B testing and email optimization. Strong written and verbal communication skills.    Your rewards will be an exciting environment with advancement opportunities at one of the nations leading and growing heavy duty truck dealer groups. Summit Truck Group offers great career opportunities, along with a competitive salary, benefits, training and a culture where we strive to help our employees to be successful.   About our Company:   Summit Holdings is a privately held company that does business as Summit Truck Group, Summit Bus, and Summit Lease & Rental. The company operates 32 commercial truck and bus dealerships in Arkansas, Kansas, Mississippi, Missouri, New Mexico, Oklahoma, Tennessee and Texas. Summit Truck Group represents and services International®, Kenworth, Volvo, Mack, Ford and Isuzu commercial trucks, and Crane Carrier specialty vehicles. Summit Truck Group delivers exceptional customer service through its more than 1,300 employees, 440 technicians, and 458 service bays.    Summit Truck Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a drug-free workplace

Digital Technology/E-Commerce Internship J.C. Penney Company, Inc. Plano, Texas   JCPenney is one of the nations largest apparel and home furnishing retailers with more than 1,000 stores and jcp.com. We are a diverse community of people, all working together to bring sensational style, sensible prices and the best service possible to our customers. Were looking for talented individuals who want to work in an energetic, respectful, collaborative environment. With a wide array of jobs, internships, training and more, there are countless opportunities for you to grow your career with us.  Imagine learning from an Omni Channel organization that helps drive the success of a multi-billion dollar business. In this 10 week internship, you will support the needs of our Digital Platform system engineering team at the JCPenney Home Office in Plano, TX (just 20 minutes north of downtown Dallas). You will help to improve jcp.coms existing continuous integration and delivery environment to support high quality products. This includes incorporating JCPenneys desktop and mobile application into the build environment as well as implementing code analysis, automated unit testing, and deploying code to test environments. Youll also have the opportunity to engage with leadership and other associates who will mentor and coach you to success through projects and hands on training.  Primary Responsibilities:  • Researching and incorporating code analysis and continuous build best practices into the existing infrastructure such as unit test execution, code analysis and suggesting improvements for deploying code to test environments • Expanding the breadth of the automated build & deploy infrastructure to include additional application suites • Incorporating various health metrics into the standard dashboards referred to by all contributing developers  Core Competencies & Accomplishments:  • Has exposure to retail e-commerce architectures/web services, continuous build & deploy environments, application development, digital technologies (desktop, mobile, tablet, iOS, Android and point-of-sale (POS)), unit testing frameworks and code analysis tools, web-based analytics tools, and software development methodology • Current college junior or senior status or first year Graduate with a major in Computer Science, MIS, Information Security, Cyber Forensics or Data Analytics (or related field) • Cumulative 3.0 GPA or higher • Outstanding leadership, excellent communication and time management skills • Ability to collaborate and be a strong team member • Excellent problem solver with the ability to take initiative • Passion for learning and sharing new technology  Start Date: May 30, 2017  Our corporate office supports the JCPenney stores nationwide and offers competitive pay. You will look forward to being a part of the JCPenney team and building lasting relationships with your fellow interns. You will also have access to numerous Home Office onsite amenities including a food court, fitness center, wellness clinic, childcare center, post office, alterations service, Walgreens, and Starbucks.  For more opportunities to join our team please visit our careers page.

Position Information  Title: Turf Marketing Intern FLSA: Hourly / Temporary Division Name / Location: Grapevine, TX Department Name: Ag & Turf Hours: Flexible 20-35 hours / week  Supervisor Title: Director of Turf     Principal Activities:  This position does the following in accordance with all applicable Federal, State and local laws / regulations and the Company’s policies, procedures and guidelines:    Assist the Ag & Turf Department with special projects, research, compiling data, creating training materials, and analysis. Generate reports regarding sales incentive programs and learn about margin reports to support decision making.     Learn about analyzing marketing proposals and programs to enable sales and executive management to evaluate programs for effectiveness. Perform pre-analysis of programs to provide information for determining the best and most cost effective programs prior to implementation.     Exposure to ROI reports for advertising and direct mail promotional campaigns as well as for sponsorship participation, merchandising, industry trade shows, and lead generation.     Exposure to CRM database program, including direct mail and customer newsletter mailing lists. Learn about ongoing CRM recommendations for promotional programs.     Learn about the effectiveness of web-based communications and create monthly reporting system for results.     Analyze, plan, and execute database marketing strategies for customer campaigns including research, documentation, scope analysis, and business case creation.     Coordinate with Customer Satisfaction Manager for the development and management of customer-segmentation, customer profiling, and data modeling for CRM programs.     Work with telemarketing firms, call centers, print, and direct mail houses to apply and assimilate data, including response analysis, while ensuring adherence to all State and Federal regulations.     Partake in strategy planning and implementation to further develop turf equipment dealerships in the SE Division market.     Help facilitate the Turf Department with preparation for dealer marketing events to include open houses and other events.     Take an active role in preparing for, setting-up for, attending and representing Kubota, at industry trade shows in the local area.     Mentor with Turf Sales and field staff by accompanying them on visits with dealer principals and dealership personnel in their respective territories.     Assist department with streamlining and improving development and training activities and tools.     Interact with dealer network by conducting phone calls for sales, service and parts promotional purposes, to conduct product and service surveys, etc.     Assist and participate in Division Events.     Provide administrative support to the Turf Department.     Complete special projects as needed and other duties as assigned.      Minimum Qualifications:  Must be actively enrolled in an undergraduate program at an accredited local University, as junior or senior working toward a Bachelor’s degree in Business, General Agriculture, Agribusiness, Ag Communications, Ag Mechanization, English, Marketing, Communications, Advertising or a degree with demonstrated relevant experience to perform the job duties. 3.0 or above Skills and Background: Strong capability in Microsoft Office Suite to include Power Point, Excel and Word; Access skills preferred; able to develop ad slicks, reports, and training materials; experience administering Facebook Updates and using other social media resources. Basic knowledge of office machines Strong interpersonal (verbal / written) communication skills. Ability to communicate with various levels of management.  High level of skill in decision making, problem solving and analytics. Organizational, multi-tasking and prioritization skills. Integrity, accuracy, dependability, enthusiasm and confidentiality Must be authorized to work in the United States without Visa sponsorship Language Requirements: Strong proficiency and sophistication in the use of English in both written and verbal formats. Physical Requirements: Ability to lift at least 30 pounds    Benefits to the Student:  Comprehensive Training  Access to top Leaders Capstone Project presented senior management Social Events throughout summer Engaging independent work that makes a difference to the business Build resume and explore post – graduation career options Flexible scheduling Real world experience Interviewing practice Letter of recommendation Potential for future employment    The information provided in the description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by incumbents within the classification. START YOUR JOURNEY AT GM FINANCIAL'S SUMMER INTERNSHIP PROGRAM GM Financial, the captive auto finance company and subsidiary of General Motors, has operations in 20 countries, providing auto finance solutions to approximately 16,000 dealers worldwide. We employ over 5,500 people and we are looking to add to our workplace! Our workforce is comprised of dedicated, hardworking, diverse team members that work together to ensure the success of GM Financial. GM Financial offers many unique opportunities to talented young professionals in our Summer Internship Program. As an intern at our company, you will gain hands-on, real-world experience alongside industry-leading professionals during the 10-week program. You will have the opportunity to develop your skills in a professional environment and build a strong foundation for your future career. We are looking for students who are ready to take on stimulating projects and gain exposure to a variety of industry initiatives. Our program offers:10 weeks of work experienceCompetitive salaryExecutive and peer networking opportunitiesIndependent and team project experiencesPhilanthropic activitiesCareer developmentOpportunity to apply for full-time career positionsAre you interested in working in the Credit Review field? Does data analytics, reporting, and designing and developing databases to help detect fraud interest you? Then we are looking for you! We are looking for candidates for the following areas:Credit Review Must be a current student pursuing a Bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited college or university in Computer Science, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or related field.Must possess a minimum of a 3.0 (out of a 4 point scale) overall GPA.Junior or Senior classification preferred.Strong written and verbal communication skills required. This incumbent will be required to give presentations and communicate with business leaders.Strong analytical, quantitative, problem solving and conceptual skills required. Must be detail oriented and able to prioritize tasks to meet deadlines.Must be able to work independently or in a team setting.Previous internships considered a plus. Working ConditionsMust be able to commit to work 40 hours for 10 consecutive weeks during the summer (First week of June through 2nd week in August)Must participate in all GMF sponsored events for interns.

Overview:    PURPOSEWe have the assets necessary to meet the building and design challenges of today’s increasing urbanization. With the most innovative cement, concrete, and aggregates solutions, strong R&D and a commitment to health, safety, and sustainability, the Company has the building solutions to meet customers’ needs, from the individual homebuilder to the largest and most complex project. We are committed to drive sustainable solutions for better building and infrastructure while contributing to a higher quality of life.  In the United States, headquartered in Chicago, Illinois, LafargeHolcim companies have sites located in 43 states and employ approximately 6,000 people. Our customers rely on us to help them design and build better communities with innovative solutions that deliver structural integrity and eco-efficiency. We are committed to contributing to Building Better Cities and are an active participant in local environmental, educational and sustainable construction initiatives, including relationships with the Wildlife Habitat Council and Habitat for Humanity. This internship will be located at one of our sites throughout the United States. communicating, improving and adhering to safety policies in all work environments and areas.Understand various operationsMaintain, organize, prepare, review and revise drawings as required.Prepare engineering scope of work for plant electrical projects.Prepare cost estimates and justifications for the capital plan.Research/recommend new PM procedures based on newly developed technologies.Collate data, establish process correlations and develop strategies for capital projectsIncumbent will get firsthand knowledge on how to ensure maximum process equipment capacity usagethrough continuous monitoring and improvement of process control parametersIncumbent will be assigned to a real job/task and expected to make a contribution that will have an impact on the businessIncumbent will be expected to utilize various skill sets/knowledgeIncumbent will be expected to make a presentation at the end of their internship to executive leadership regarding what they bills of materials (BOMs) for electrical equipment.Interface with contractors utilized in project work, including solicitation of quotes, selection and field direction.Conduct economic and operation feasibility studies on proposed electrical modifications and additions.Maintain a standard set of specifications for consistent application related to modifications or additions.Develop detailed preventative maintenance routines for all plant electrical equipment.Use SAP to purchase parts and services, review work orders, analyse reports and manage capital projects related to electrical project management and PM development.Other duties as assigned.RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHER JOBSWorks closely with the equipment suppliers, plant staff and Process Area Teams to ensure the successful operation of the plant. position: Summer Scholar, Business Analyst - Human Capital, Actuarial - Columbia University
Job Description: Are you an analytical thinker with a passion for actuarial sciences and an interest in helping organizations solve complex actuarial business problems through interpreting large data sets? We're looking for a Business Analyst Intern to work with our Human Capital Actuarial team. You'll help to build financial and mathematical models that can improve organizational performance. From the start, you'll be involved with multiple project teams and clients that may include insurance companies, employers, and governments.  Work you'll do  Our work is interesting and complex, and while quantifying risk via statistical methods is part of what we do, that won't be the only way you add value to our clients' businesses. You will have the opportunity to serve clients in other strategic and operational capacities based on extensive exposure to these clients and deep analytical strengths.  The team  Human Capital professionals who specialize in Actuarial services apply advanced quantitative analysis to a wide range of business challenges. We use leading-edge statistical methods to quantify risk of Health, Life, P&C, and Retirement plans for clients. Learn more about our Human Capital Actuarial practice.  Qualifications  Required  * Enrollment in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program in related field of study  * Strong academic track record (minimum GPA of 3.2)  * Proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation creation tools, as well as Internet research tools  * Demonstrable interest in taking SOA or CAS actuarial exams, with at least one exam passed  * Excellent communication skills  * Willingness to travel  How you'll grow  Two of the most important tools in today's business world are experience and resources. At Deloitte, you'll find plenty of both. During this 8-10 week long learning experience, you'll gain first-hand insights into technical skills, critical professional behaviors, standards, and mindsets needed to be an effective actuarial consultant. You'll work with a wide variety of talented, strategic leaders, learn how to leverage data and statistics, tackle real-world business challenges, and experience the day-to-day responsibilities and opportunities of this exciting, forward-facing career. Your tailored training program will start on day 1 and be supplemented with learning opportunities throughout the summer, whether on the job, virtual, or in the office on Fridays. The summer will also feature networking opportunities with firm leadership and interns across the organization during the national summer intern conference at Deloitte University. Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Center.  Deloitte's culture  Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte. The Internship Program  Our paid internship program is designed to be an educational and engaging opportunity for students to work on challenging projects that help us achieve our mission and goals. Students will experience an emersion in corporate life with training, access to leaders, social events, mentoring, and a capstone project presented to senior management.  Position Information  Title: Turf Marketing Intern  FLSA: Hourly / Temporary  Division Name / Location: Grapevine, TX  Department Name: Ag & Turf  Hours: Flexible 20-35 hours / week  Supervisor Title: Director of Turf  Principal Activities:  This position does the following in accordance with all applicable Federal, State and local laws / regulations and the Companys policies, procedures and guidelines:  Assist the Ag & Turf Department with special projects, research, compiling data, creating training materials, and analysis.  Generate reports regarding sales incentive programs and learn about margin reports to support decision making.  Learn about analyzing marketing proposals and programs to enable sales and executive management to evaluate programs for effectiveness. Perform pre-analysis of programs to provide information for determining the best and most cost effective programs prior to implementation.  Exposure to ROI reports for advertising and direct mail promotional campaigns as well as for sponsorship participation, merchandising, industry trade shows, and lead generation.  Exposure to CRM database program, including direct mail and customer newsletter mailing lists. Learn about ongoing CRM recommendations for promotional programs.  Learn about the effectiveness of web-based communications and create monthly reporting system for results.  Analyze, plan, and execute database marketing strategies for customer campaigns including research, documentation, scope analysis, and business case creation.  Coordinate with Customer Satisfaction Manager for the development and management of customer-segmentation, customer profiling, and data modeling for CRM programs.  Work with telemarketing firms, call centers, print, and direct mail houses to apply and assimilate data, including response analysis, while ensuring adherence to all State and Federal regulations.  Partake in strategy planning and implementation to further develop turf equipment dealerships in the SE Division market.  Help facilitate the Turf Department with preparation for dealer marketing events to include open houses and other events.  Take an active role in preparing for, setting-up for, attending and representing Kubota, at industry trade shows in the local area.  Mentor with Turf Sales and field staff by accompanying them on visits with dealer principals and dealership personnel in their respective territories.  Assist department with streamlining and improving development and training activities and tools.  Interact with dealer network by conducting phone calls for sales, service and parts promotional purposes, to conduct product and service surveys, etc.  Assist and participate in Division Events.  Provide administrative support to the Turf Department.  Complete special projects as needed and other duties as assigned.  Minimum Qualifications:  Must be actively enrolled in an undergraduate program at an accredited local University, as junior or senior working toward a Bachelors degree in Business, General Agriculture, Agribusiness, Ag Communications, Ag Mechanization, English, Marketing, Communications, Advertising or a degree with demonstrated relevant experience to perform the job duties. 3.0 or above  Skills and Background: Strong capability in Microsoft Office Suite to include Power Point, Excel and Word; Access skills preferred; able to develop ad slicks, reports, and training materials; experience administering Facebook Updates and using other social media resources. Basic knowledge of office machines  Strong interpersonal (verbal / written) communication skills. Ability to communicate with various levels of management.  High level of skill in decision making, problem solving and analytics. Organizational, multi-tasking and prioritization skills. Integrity, accuracy, dependability, enthusiasm and confidentiality  Must be authorized to work in the United States without Visa sponsorship  Language Requirements: Strong proficiency and sophistication in the use of English in both written and verbal formats. position: Deloitte Corporate Finance Data Analyst Intern - Dallas
Job Description: Do you want to jump start your career and take your business skills to the next level by joining Deloitte's team? This is your chance to get a head start before you graduate. Join our group of interns and you'll get an inside look at what it's really like to work for a professional services organization.  Work you'll do  In this position, you will be assigned to a group within in one of our internal services group. You'll gain real-world experience working on meaningful projects. You will have the opportunity to collaborate and consult with Deloitte professionals. You'll use your exceptional organizational skills to meet deadlines and work with diverse groups locally and nationally based professionals. Responsibilities for this role could include the following:  * Manage the potential list of invites for the annual Corporate Finance conference including those in the broader Deloitte network, Private Equity firms and other sought after participants.  * Refine the conference invite list by looking at key information in the database.  * Track the referred companies and Deloitte professionals as the part of the roll out of the OneDeloitte referral program.  * Partner with the Business Development committee to commence a database mining project designed to assign Classification NAIC codes to prospective companies  How you'll grow  Throughout the course of the internship program, you will receive formal and informal mentorship and training. You will have access to learning opportunities to help foster and accelerate your development of new skills and capabilities. Beyond the formal training, you will work with talented professionals and have the chance to ask questions and gain valuable hands-on experience while working on client engagements.  Qualifications  Required  * Open to students interested in any field of study  * Keen interest in professional services  * Professional demeanor and strong communication skills, both written and oral  * Demonstrated leadership qualities and leadership potential  * Ability to work independently and within a team culture  * Ability to quickly and concisely collect and report out on data  Preferred  * 3.2 cumulative GPA strongly preferred  The team  Our Corporate Finance team assists clients with financial and strategic advisory to include sellside and buyside M&A, capital raising, and evaluation of corporate finance alternatives including Employee Stock Ownership Plans ("ESOPs"). Interns work in a collaborative environment where real-time performance feedback is encouraged and will be given responsibilities based on performance and capability. Opportunities for full-time positions may be available to high performers. Learn more about our Corporate Finance practice.
